ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Rico, I was able to run all of the matlab tutorial problems using a linux setup with the current cvs version of Cantera. I used the following programs:

Hi Rico,

I was able to run all of the matlab tutorial problems using a lin=
ux
setup with the current cvs version of Cantera. I used the following
prog=
rams:


Linux redhat, 64 bit 

Gcc 3.4.3 

Matlab 7.4.0 (R2007a)

Cantera's=
 current cvs distribution 


Unfortunately, I don't have a pc version of ma=
tlab to check out your
issues on that platform. However, I did fix a UMR in=
 a file that ck2cti
uses on 5/31/2007 that sometimes caused seg faults in o=
ptimized versions
of the code. The issue you are seeing here may be due to =
that bug.

Best wishes,
Harry Moffat

ogroups.com
Subject: [cantera] Error: could not convert input file to CTML.=


Hi everybody,

in former posts the same error is already mentioned. To so=
lve the
problem there was the suggest to change to MATLAB 7.4.0 (R2007a),
b=
ecause of difficulties in use of dll-entries.
But I still have the same pro=
blem with MATLAB 7.4.0 Running the
tutorial1 for MATLAB there is the follow=
ing error message

??? 

************************************************
 =

***************************=
*********************

Error:   could not convert input=
 file to CTML.
 Command line was: 
python "C:\DOKUME~1\user\LOKALE~1\Temp/.=
cttmp1187791292.pyw">
C:\DOKUME~1\user\LOKALE~1\Temp/ct2ctml.log 2>&1

Erro=
r in =3D=3D> XML_Node.XML_Node at 11
   x.id =3D ctmethods(10,15,0,src); % =
newxml(name)

Error in =3D=3D> Solution.Solution at 30
doc =3D XML_Node('do=
c',src);

Error in =3D=3D> GRI30 at 22
  s =3D Solution('gri30.cti','gri30'=
);

Error in =3D=3D> tut1 at 12
gas1=3DGRI30



Please could anybody help m=
e with this problem? How can I get the right
file that is necessary (ct2ctm=
l, ck2ctml, whatever...)

Thank you so much.

rico
